p: Rectal cancer patients still often experience surgical complications, regardless of the important progress made so far within both techniques and perioperative management. In this study, considerable short-term survival benefits in favor of the LAR group were achieved. Overall, post-operative complication rate was higher in APER group which was mainly caused by the high incidence of perineal wound failure and they had a significantly longer length of primary hospital stay compared to LAR patient (median 12 vs. 7Â days, Table 3). The anastomotic leak rate in LAR was 13%.
